TopicTitle: How did you find out about Kerbal Space Program

Articles.Content: Just a Small Poll

EDIT: Why is this in the challanges section?

I just saw an Image on r/gaming in reddit of a rocket made of SRBs, I asked what game it was, was told it was KSP, bought the full version that minute.
was watching kurtjmac\'s youtube videos and he had a KSP playlist, watched all of them then bought the game.
Last year I read about KSP on ROBLOX forum, so I tried it out and enjoyed it and eventually bought it this year

Last year I read about KSP on ROBLOX forum, so I tried it out and enjoyed it and eventually bought it this year

One shudders to imagine what inhuman thoughts lie behind that forum.
Reddit /r/gaming last summer, think the version was 0.7
There was a huge thread about it on 4chan a few months ago, and I happened to see it.
I heard about Kerbal Space Program from the youtube use Kurtjmac. You may have heard of him from his signature Minecraft 'Farlands Or Bust' series.
Jefmajor livestream.

I saw this article on Gamespy last March talking about Kerbal. http://pc.gamespy.com/pc/kerbal-space-program/1221987p1.html

It looked so cool that I had to download the demo immediately.
Looks like the most common reason people heard of it was because of Kurt
It was a combination of friends and Youtube, so just voted Other. ???
ROBBAZ a youtuber guy
Robbaz is the best. He\'s the King of Sweden, I subbed to him after the VALLHALA PARK
Saw a random comment on a Hungarian gamer site under some space related game. Checked out KSP site, two or three videos -> instant buy, about two weeks ago.
Like many, I found it through kurtjmac.
Facepunch forums.
Someone in my programming class was playing it a while ago. We kept calling it 'Keebler Space Program' by accident

another one of these??? like i have to say (for what?? the 8th time???) issue 97 of uk CPC magazine (around October last year). those who joined the comunity after (AFTER) robbaz, i really disliked. so ignorant and just thick headed (not that those here are, just stereo typing here). maybe because im hipster like that xD

Found the 'Orbiter' simulator. Thought it was too hard and too advanced, so I searched 'space simulator' on Google. Found KSP. And was stuck

Cheers
I saw some videos on Youtube about it on the Yogscast channel. As a huge fan of BARIS it immediately peaked my interest and the purchase came minutes later

There is a bit of a story to this one...

I\'m a laser technician, and I work for a company that supplies industrial and scientific lasers, as well as laser pointers. Some guy had bought a laser pointer, and in the order notes box he put 'can you please draw a snake on the box.' We didn\'t catch the note until after his order had shipped, so we mailed him some snake stickers the following day. When he received the stickers along with an apology letter from the company president. He thought this was great, and subsequently posted a picture to reddit, which made the front page that afternoon. Somebody e-mailed us about it, and the whole company saw the reddit post. We decided to include free stickers with every order that mentioned reddit (there were many) along with rage face stickers and even laser-engraved boxes. Over the following few days, I kept checking reddit to see if any more of our handiwork was being submitted. While searching for the word 'laser' I found a submission on the /r/kerbalspaceprogram subreddit about how a guy had deployed a laser reflector on the Mun. I was intrigued, so I clicked it, and saw it was some kind of game. I looked at the subreddit, saw a few of the submissions and screenshots, and checked out the website. The rest is history.

tl;dr I saw it on reddit.

I was reading some forum thread somewhere about (Buzz Aldrin\'s) Race Into Space, which I was busy playing...and someone randomly mentioned KSP. Searched for it...downloaded the demo...quickly forked over $15 for access to the most recent version (then 0.15).

BARIS/RIS is a really good game and at some point, I\'m going to go back and take a stab at playing as the Russians in Historical mode. But KSP is more than a really good game...it\'s the stuff happy obsessions are made of.
PC Gamer magazine, during 0.9.
Yer sorry for puting it on challenges is just my first poll and didnt know till after i applied it sorry but thanks.
